Material used.Material Name: Alpha-Synuclein (WT and mutants A30P, E46K, A53T)
Material used.Description: Double cysteine mutants of wild type (WT), and Parkinson disease (PD) mutants A30P, E46K, and A53T of alpha-synuclein were expressed, purified, and spin-labeled with MTSSL.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutant shows decreased affinity for lipid membranes and increased flexibility or disorder in the extended helix conformation compared to WT.
E46K mutant shows similar behavior to WT in adopting extended helix conformation when bound to vesicles or bicelles.
A53T mutant shows similar behavior to WT in adopting extended helix conformation when bound to vesicles or bicelles.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein was used as a positive control for comparison with mutants.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: L-curve Tikhonov regularization and Maximum Entropy Method (MEM) for distance distribution analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Inter-spin distances consistent with extended helix conformation (5.5-8.7 nm depending on label positions).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Inter-spin distances indicative of broken helix or unbound state (shorter than expected for extended helix, e.g., 3-4 nm).
